intro: Conioselinum tataricum, commonly known as Tatarian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss in arid environments.
